subject: THE WAY TO KEEP PEACE
verse: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but harsh words stir  up trouble. (Proverbs 15:1)
reflection:
Have you ever tried to argue in a whisper?
It is equally hard to argue with someone who insists on answering gently. On the other hand, a rising voice and harsh words almost always trigger an angry response. To turn away wrath and seek peace, choose gentle words.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me become a positive example to others. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b0389350bd3d67
subject   : Subject: THE WAY TO KEEP PEACE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 1 Aug 2021 16:05:29 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*A gentle answer turns away wrath, but harsh words stir *

*up trouble. *(Pro. 15:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Have you ever tried to argue in a whisper? It is equally hard to

argue with someone who insists on answering gently. On the

other hand, a rising voice and harsh words almost always trigger

an angry response. To turn away wrath and seek peace, choose

gentle words.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me become a positive example to *

*others. **Amen.*

subject: HE IS AWARE OF ALL THINGS
verse: The Lord is watching everywhere, keeping His eyes on both the evil and the good. (Proverbs 15:3)
reflection: At times it seems like God is letting evil run rampant in the world, and we wonder if He even notices. But God sees everything clearly —both the evil actions and the evil intentions lying behind them. He is not an indifferent observer. He cares and is active in our world. Right NOW , His work may be unseen and unfelt, but don’t give up. One day He will wipe out evil and punish evil- doers, just as He will establish the good and reward those who do His will.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray for patience and that I will remain faithful while waiting for that wonderful day! Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b09020a0685e9b
subject   : Subject: HE IS AWARE OF ALL THINGS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 2 Aug 2021 17:35:34 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord is watching everywhere, keeping His eyes on both the evil*

*and the good. *(Pro. 15:3)



*Reflection:*

At times it seems like God is letting evil run rampant in the world,

and we wonder if He even notices. But God sees everything clearly

—both the evil actions and the evil intentions lying behind them.

He is not an indifferent observer. He cares and is active in our

world. Right *NOW*, His work may be unseen and unfelt, but

don’t give up. One day He will wipe out evil and punish evil-

doers, just as He will establish the good and reward those who do

His will.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, I pray for patience and that I will remain faithful *

*while waiting for that wonderful day! Amen.*

subject: WHAT DOES YOUR APPETITE CRAVE
verse:
A wise person is hungry for truth, while a fool feeds on trash.
(Proverbs 15:14)
reflection: What we feed our mind is just as important as what we feed our body. The kinds of books we read, the people we talk with, the musicwe listen to, and the films we watch are all a part of our mental diet. Be discerning because what you feed your mind influences your total health and well-being. Thus, a strong desire to discover know- ledge is a mark of wisdom.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will not be led by th e world’s three enemies—the world—Satan—and our own flesh. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b0deea89b77f32
subject   : Subject: WHAT DOES YOUR APPETITE CRAVE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 3 Aug 2021 16:32:30 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*A wise person is hungry for truth, while a fool feeds on trash.*

(Pro. 15:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

What we feed our mind is just as important as what we feed our

body. The kinds of books we read, the people we talk with, the

musicwe listen to, and the films we watch are all a part of our mental

diet. Be discerning because what you feed your mind influences your

total health and well-being. Thus, a strong desire to discover know-

ledge is a mark of wisdom.

*Pastor Sather*


*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will not be led by th**e world’s*

*three enemies—the world—Satan—and our own flesh. **Amen.*

subject: THE IMPORTANCE OF WHAT YOU FOCUS ON
verse: For the poor, every day brings trouble; for the happy heart,  life is a continual feast. (Proverbs 15:15)
reflection:
Our attitudes color our whole personality.
We cannot always choose what happens to us, but we can choose our attitude toward each situation. The secret to a happy heart is filling your mind with thoughts that are pure, and lovely, with thoughts that dwell on the good things in life (Philippians 4:8). This was Paul’s secret as he faced imprisonment, and it can be ours as we face the struggles of daily living. Look at your attitudes and then examine what you allow to enter your mind and what you choose to dwell on. You may need to make some changes.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me focus my mind on what is good and pure, I pray in Jesus’ name. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*For** the poor, every day brings trouble; for the happy heart, *

*life is a continual feast. *(Pro. 15:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Our attitudes color our whole personality. We cannot always

choose what happens to us, but we can choose our attitude toward

each situation. The secret to a happy heart is filling your mind with

thoughts that are pure, and lovely, with thoughts that dwell on the

good things in life (Phil. 4:8). This was Paul’s secret as he faced

imprisonment, and it can be ours as we face the struggles of daily

living. Look at your attitudes and then examine what you allow to

enter your mind and what you choose to dwell on. You may need to

make some changes.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, help me focus my mind on what is good and pure, *

*I pray in Jesus’ name. **Amen. *

subject: KEEPING OUR STANDARDS HIGH
verse: Foolishness brings joy to those who have no sense; a sensible  person stays on the right path. Plans go wrong for lack of advice; many counselors bring success. (Proverbs 15:21, 22)
reflection: People with tunnel vision, those who are locked into one way of thinking, are likely to miss the right road because they have closed their minds to any new options. We need the help of those who can enlarge our vision and broaden our perspective. Seek out the advice of those who know you and have a wealth of experience. Build a network of advisers. Then be open to new ideas, and be willing to weigh their suggestions carefully. Your plans will be stronger and more likely to succeed.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to weigh carefully the advice and suggestions of those who have had more experience in life. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b1d2bec302fd21
subject   : Subject: KEEPING OUR STANDARDS HIGH

date      : Fri, 6 Aug 2021 15:33:43 -0500
===================================================================

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Foolishness brings joy to those who have no sense; a sensible *

*person stays on the right path. Plans go wrong for lack of advice;*

*many counselors bring success. *(Pro. 15:21, 22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

People with tunnel vision*,* those who are locked into one way of

thinking*, *are likely to miss the right road because they have closed

their minds to any new options. We need the help of those who

can enlarge our vision and broaden our perspective. Seek out the

advice of those who know you and have a wealth of experience*.*

Build a network of advisers. Then be open to new ideas, and be

willing to weigh their suggestions carefully. Your plans will be

stronger and more likely to succeed.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to weigh carefully the advice and*

*suggestions of those who have had more experience in life. **Amen.*

subject: WEIGH CAREFULLY WHAT YOU ARE ABOUT TO SAY
verse: The godly think before speaking; the wicked spout evil word The Lord is far from the wicked, but He hears the prayers of the righteous. (Proverbs 15:28, 29)
reflection: The godly weigh their answers, the wicked don’t think before speaking because they don’t care about the effects of their words. It is important to have something to say, but is equally important to think about it first. Do you carefully plan your words, or do you poor out your thoughts without concern for their impact?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will forgive me if I have wounded any soul today by some careless words I may have said in haste. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b226cb8f09e527
subject   : Subject: WEIGH CAREFULLY WHAT YOU ARE ABOUT TO SAY
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 7 Aug 2021 16:02:36 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The godly think before speaking; the wicked spout evil word*

*The Lord is far from the wicked, but He hears the prayers of the*

*righteous. *(Pro. 15:28, 29)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The godly weigh their answers, the wicked don’t think before

speaking because they don’t care about the effects of their words.

It is important to have something to say, but is equally important

to think about it first. Do you carefully plan your words, or do you

poor out your thoughts without concern for their impact?

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will forgive me if I *

*have wounded any soul today by some careless words I may *

*have said in haste. **Amen.*

subject: THE NEED OF GOD'S PARTNERSHIP
verse: We can gather our thoughts, but the Lord gives the right answer. (Proverbs 16:1)
reflection: This verse can be understood to mean that the final outcome of the plans we make is in God’s hands. If that is so, why make plans? In doing God’s will, there must be partnership between our efforts and God’s control. He wants us to use our minds, to seek the advice of others, and to plan. Nevertheless, the results are up to Him. Planning, then, helps us to act God’s way. As you live for Him, ask for guidance as you plan, and then, act on your plan as you trust in Him.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to always places my trust in You, so as to believe that You know what is best. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b27a28797d2bae
subject   : Subject: THE NEED OF GOD'S PARTNERSHIP
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 8 Aug 2021 16:19:28 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*We can gather our thoughts, but the Lord gives the right answer.*

(Pro. 16:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This verse can be understood to mean that the final outcome of

the plans we make is in God’s hands. *If that is so*, *why make *

*plans?* In doing God’s will, *there must be* partnership between

our efforts and God’s control. He wants us to use our minds, to

seek the advice of others, *and* to plan. Nevertheless, the results

are up to Him. Planning, then, helps us to act God’s way. As you

live for Him, ask for guidance as you plan, *and then,* act on

your plan as you trust in Him.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, help me to always places my trust in You, so as to*

*believe that You know what is best. **Amen. *

subject: MAKING A TRUTHFUL EXAMINATION
verse: People may be pure in their own eyes, but the Lord examines  heir motives. (Proverbs 16:2)
reflection:
People can rationalize anything if they have no standards jud-
ging right and wrong. We can always prove that we are right. But before putting any plan into action, ask yourself these quest- ions: (1) Is this plan in harmony with God’s truth? (2)
Will it work under real-life conditions? (3) Is my attitude pleasing to God?
If you have answered these questions truthfully, your plans will be pleasing to God!
prayer: O Lord of all grace and mercy, help me to always examine my thoughts and actions to see if they stand up under these three questions. Amen.
original_content:

===================================================================

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*People may be pure in their own eyes, but the Lord examines *

*heir motives. *(Pro. 16:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

People can rationalize anything if they have no standards jud-

ging right and wrong. We can always prove that we are right*. *

*But* before putting any plan into action, ask yourself these quest-

ions: (1) Is this plan in harmony with God’s truth? (2) Will it

work under real-life conditions? (3) Is my attitude pleasing to

God*? If* you have answered these questions truthfully, your

plans will be pleasing to God!

*Pastor Sather*

*O Lord of all grace and mercy, help me to always examine *

*my thoughts and actions to see if they stand up under these *

*three questions. **Amen.*

subject: ENTRUSTING EVERYTHING TO GOD
verse: Commit your work to the Lord, and then your plans will succeed. (Proverbs 16:3)
reflection: There are different ways to fail to commit what ever we do to the Lord. Some people commit their work only superficially. They say the project is being done for the Lord, but in reality they are doing it for themselves. Others give God temporary control of their interests, only to take control back the moment things stop going the way they expect. Still others commit a task fully to the Lord but put forward no effort themselves, and then they wonder why they do not succeed. We must maintain a delicate balance: trusting God as though everything depended on Him, while work- ing as if everything depends on us. Think of a specific effort in which you are involved right now. Have you committed it to the Lord? Sather Pastor Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always put my full trust in You. Amen.
prayer: Heavenly Father, guide us to fully commit our efforts to You while diligently working as Your faithful servants, trusting in Your providence and wisdom in all we do. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17b31a00ccf155f3
subject   : Subject: ENTRUSTING EVERYTHING TO GOD
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 10 Aug 2021 14:52:58 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Commit your work to the Lord, and then your plans will succeed.*

(Pro. 16:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

There are different ways to fail to commit what ever we do to the

Lord. Some people commit their work only superficially. They

say the project is being done for the Lord, but in reality they are

doing it for themselves. Others give God temporary control of

their interests, only to take control back the moment things stop

going the way they expect. *Still others* commit a task fully to the

Lord but put forward no effort themselves, and then they wonder

why they do not succeed. We must maintain a delicate balance:

trusting God as though everything depended on Him, while work-

ing as if everything depends on us. Think of a specific effort in

which you are involved right now. Have you committed it to the

Lord?

*Sather* *Pastor*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always put my full trust in *

*You. **Amen.*

subject: MADE FOR GOD'S GLORY
verse: The Lord has made everything for His own purpose even  the wicked for punishment. (Proverbs 16:4)
reflection:
Now this verse does not mean that God created some people
to be wicked, but rather that God uses even the activities of
wicked people for His purpose (read Genesis 50:20). God is infinite and we are finite .
No matter how great our intellects,
we will never be able to understand Him completely. But we
can accept by faith that His is all-powerful, all-loving, and
perfectly good. We can believe that He is not the cause of
evil (James 1:13-17), and we can trust there are no loose ends
is His system of judgement. Evil is a temporary condition in
the universe. One day God will destroy it.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I look forward to the day when there will be no more evil in the world. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b372486a1fc6b4

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord has made everything for His own purpose even *

*the wicked for punishment. *(Pro. 16:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Now this verse does not mean that God created some people

to be wicked, *but *rather that God uses even the activities of

wicked people for His purpose (read Gen. 50:20). God is

*infinite *and we are *finite*. No matter how great our intellects,

we will never be able to understand Him completely. But we

can accept by faith that His is all-powerful, all-loving, and

perfectly good. We can believe that He is not the cause of

evil (Jm. 1:13-17), and we can trust there are no loose ends

is His system of judgement. Evil is a temporary condition in

the universe. One day God will destroy it.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I look forward to the day when *

*there will be no more evil in the world. **Amen. *

subject: NO UNCONFESSED SIN GOES WITHOUT PUNISHMENT
verse: The Lord despises pride; be assured that the proud will be punished. Unfailing love and faithfulness cover sin; evil is avoided by fear of the Lord. (Proverbs 16:5-6)
reflection:
Some people have a little inner voice that sometimes whispers “My way is best.” This has been known to be pride . To much pride has a way of resisting God’s leadership and believing that he or she are able to live without God’s help. If you find yourself wanting to do it your way or looking down on other people, you are being controlled by pride. Only when you eliminate pride
can God Help you, become all that He meant you to be.
prayer: I pray that You will forgive me when my thoughts and actions are less than pleasing to you. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b3c5cbd85ab5a3

date      : Thu, 12 Aug 2021 16:55:16 -0500

*Today’s Verses:*

*The Lord despises pride; be assured that the proud will*

* be punished. Unfailing love and faithfulness cover sin;*

* evil is avoided by fear of the Lord. *(Pro. 16:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Some people have a little inner voice that sometimes whispers

“My way is best.” This has been known to be *pride*. To much

pride has a way of resisting God’s leadership and believing that

he or she are able to live without God’s help. If you find yourself wanting
to do it your way or looking down on other people, you

are being controlled by pride. Only when you eliminate pride

can God Help you, become all that He meant you to be.

*Pastor Sather*

*I pray that You will forgive me when my thoughts and actions *

*are less than pleasing to you. **Amen. *

subject: HE HAS THE WHOLE WORLD IN HIS HANDS
verse: We can make our plans, but the Lord determines our steps. (Proverbs 16:9)
reflection: The steps of the godly are directed by the Lord; eventhough we may stumble, we will not fall. The person in whom the Lord delights is on who follows Him, trusts in Him, and tries to do His will. God watches over and makes firm every step that person takes. If you would like to have God direct your way, then seek His advise before you step out.
prayer: O Lord of all grace and mercy, help me to remain faithful so that I seek Your advise before I make my own plans. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*We can make our plans, but the Lord determines our*

* steps. *(Pro. 16:9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The steps of the godly are directed by the Lord; eventhough

we may stumble, we will not fall. The person in whom the

Lord delights is on who follows Him, trusts in Him, and tries

to do His will. God watches over and makes firm every step

that person takes. If you would like to have God direct your

way, then seek His advise before you step out.

*Pastor Sather*

*O Lord of all grace and mercy, help me to remain *

*faithful so that I seek Your advise before I make my *

*own plans. **Amen.*

subject: HONESTY IS THE BEST POLICY
verse: The lord demands fairness in every business deal; He sets the stand. (Proverbs 16:11)
reflection:
Whether we buy or sell, make a product or offer a
service, we know what is fair and honest and what
is unfair and dishonest. Sometimes we feel pressure
to be dishonest to advance ourselves or gain more
profit.
But we want to obey God, there is no middle
ground.
God demands honesty in every business
transaction.
No amount of rationalizing can justify
a dishonest business practice. Honesty and fairness
are not always easy, but they are what God demands.
Ask Him for discernment and courage to be consist-
ently honest and fair.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for discernment on all my dealings. Amen.
original_content:

*The lord demands fairness in every business deal;*

*He sets the stand. *(Pro. 16:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Whether we buy or sell, make a product or offer a

service, we know what is fair and honest and what

is unfair and dishonest. Sometimes we feel pressure

to be dishonest to advance ourselves or gain more

profit. But we want to obey God, there is no middle

ground. God demands honesty in every business

a dishonest business practice. Honesty and fairness

are not always easy, but they are what God demands.

Ask Him for discernment and courage to be consist-

ently honest and fair.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for discernment on *

*all my dealings. **Amen.*

subject: TO MUCH PRIDE--CAN BE A PROBLEM
verse: Pride goes before destruction, and haughtiness before a fall.  (Proverbs 16:18)
reflection: Proud people take little account of their weakness and do not anticipate stumbling blocks. They think they are above the frailties of common people. In this state of mind they are easily tripped up. Ironically, proud people seldom realize that pride is their problem, although everyone around them is well aware of it. Ask someone you trust whether self-satisfaction has blinded you to warning signs. He or she may help you avoid a fall.
prayer: O Lord of all wisdom, please correct any problem I may have that would draw me from Your righteous right hand. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b4b7af61b33339
subject   : Subject: TO MUCH PRIDE--CAN BE A PROBLEM
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 15 Aug 2021 15:22:35 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Pride goes before destruction, and haughtiness before a fall. *

(Pro. 16:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Proud people take little account of their weakness and do not

anticipate stumbling blocks. They think they are above the frailties

of common people. In this state of mind they are easily tripped up.

Ironically, proud people seldom realize that pride is their problem,
although everyone around them is well aware of it. Ask someone

you trust whether self-satisfaction has blinded you to warning signs.

He or she may help you avoid a fall.

* Pastor Sather*

*O Lord of all wisdom, please correct any problem I may have that would
draw me from Your righteous right hand. **Amen.*

subject: WISDOM IS THE BETTER PART OF VALOR
verse: Discretion is a life-giving fountain to those who possess  it, but discipline is wasted on fools. (Proverbs 16:22)
reflection:
For centuries people sought a fountain of youth, a spring
that promised to give eternal life and vitality. It was never
found. But God’s wisdom is a life-giving fountain that can
make a person, happy, healthy, and alive forever. How?
When we live by God’s Word, He washes away the deadly
effects of sin (read Titus 3:4-8), and the hope of eternal
life with Him that gives us a joyful perspective on our
present life. The fountain of life was only a dream, but the
life-giving is a reality. The choice is yours. We can be
enlightened by God’s wisdom, or we can be dragged
down by the weight of our own foolishness.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, search my heart and enlighten it with Your wisdom. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b50dcd4281eac1
subject   : Subject: WISDOM IS THE BETTER PART OF VALOR
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 16 Aug 2021 16:27:35 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Discretion is a life-giving fountain to those who possess *

*it, but discipline is wasted on fools. *(Pro. 16:22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

For centuries people sought a fountain of youth, a spring

that promised to give eternal life and vitality. It was never

found. But God’s wisdom is a life-giving fountain that can

make a person, happy, healthy, and alive forever. How?

When we live by God’s Word, He washes away the deadly

effects of sin (read Titus 3:4-8), and the hope of eternal

life with Him that gives us a joyful perspective on our

present life. The fountain of life was only a dream, but the

life-giving is a reality. *The choice is yours.* We can be

enlightened by God’s wisdom, or we can be dragged

down by the weight of our own foolishness.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, search my heart and enlighten it*

*with Your wisdom. **Amen.*

subject: GRAY HAIR DESERVES RESPECT
verse: Gray hair is a crown of glory, it is received by living a  godly life. (Proverbs 16:31)
reflection:
The Hebrews believed that a long life was a sign of
God’s blessing; therefore, gray hair and old age were
good. While young people glory in their strength,
old people can rejoice in their years of experience
and practical wisdom. Gray hair is not a sign of disgrace
to be covered up; it is a crown of splendor.
As you deal
with older people, treat them with respect.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, as I grow older and grayer help me to live in such a way as to receive the respect that elderly people deserve. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b55d4e89f834da
subject   : Subject: GRAY HAIR DESERVES RESPECT
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 17 Aug 2021 15:37:02 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Gray hair is a crown of glory, it is received by living a *

*godly life. *(Pro. 16:31)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Hebrews believed that a long life was a sign of

God’s blessing; therefore, gray hair and old age were

good. While young people glory in their strength,

old people can rejoice in their years of experience

and practical wisdom. Gray hair is not a sign of disgrace

to be covered up; it is a crown of splendor. As you deal

with older people, treat them with respect.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, as I grow older and grayer help*

* me to live in such a way as to receive the respect *

*that elderly people deserve. **Amen. *

subject: THE IMPORTANCE OF RESTRAINT
verse:
It is more important to be patient than powerful: it is better to have self-control than to conquer a city. We may throw the dice, but the Lord determines how they  fall.
(Proverbs 16:32, 33)
reflection:
Self-control is superior to conquest. Success in busin-
ess, school, or home life can be ruined by a person
who loses control of his or her temper, So it is a great
personal victory to control your temper. When you
feel yourself ready to explode, remember that losing
control may cause you to forfeit what you want most.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, when I feel like I am about to lose my self-control remind me to bite my tongue Amen

*Today’s Verses:*

*It is more important to be patient than powerful: it is*

*better to have self-control than to conquer a city. We*

*may throw the dice, but the Lord determines how they *

*fall. *(Pro. 16:32, 33)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Self-control is superior to conquest. Success in busin-

ess, school, or home life can be ruined by a person

who loses control of his or her temper, So it is a great

personal victory to control your temper. When you

feel yourself ready to explode, remember that losing

control may cause you to forfeit what you want most.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, when I feel like I am about*

*to lose my self-control remind me to bite my tongue*

*Amen*

subject: OUR FAITH WILL BE TESTED
verse: Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the Lord  tests the heart. (Proverbs 17:3)
reflection:
It takes intense heat to purify gold and sliver, similarly, it often takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be purified through trials. God shows us what is in us and clears out anything that gets in the way of complete trust in Him. Peter says“These trials are only to test your faith, to show that it is strong and pure. It is being tested as fire
tests and purifies gold—and your faith is far more precious to God than mere gold” (I Peter 1:7). So when tough times come your way, realize that God wants to use them to refine your faith and purify your heart.
prayer: Dear Lord, when trials come my way, help me realize that You may be testing my faith. I pray that my faith will stand up under the test. Amen.

message_id: 17b603b25245f276

*Today’s Verse:*

*Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the **Lord *

*tests the heart. *(Pro. 17:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It takes intense heat to purify gold and sliver, similarly,

it often takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be

purified through trials. God shows us what is in us and

clears out anything that gets in the way of complete trust

in Him. Peter says“These trials are only to test your faith,

to show that it is strong and pure. It is being tested as fire

tests and purifies gold—and your faith is far more precious

to God than mere gold” (I Pet.1:7). So when tough times

come your way, realize that God wants to use them to

refine your faith and purify your heart.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, when trials come my way, help me **realize that *

*You may be testing my faith. I pray **that my faith will stand *

*up **under the test. **Amen.*

subject: LEAVE ALL JUDGEMENTS TO THE CREATOR
verse: Wrongdoers listen to wicked talk; liars pay attention to destructive words. Those who mock the poor indult their Maker; those who rejoice at the misfortune of others will be punished. (Proverbs 17:4, 5)
reflection:
Few acts are as cruel as making fun of the less fortunate,
but many people do this because it makes them feel good
to be better off or more successful than someone else.
Mocking the poor is mocking the God who made them.
We also ridicule God when we mock the weak, those
who are different, or anyone else. When you catch your-
self putting others down just for fun, stop and think about who created them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me if I should ever make cruel statements about those who are less fortunate than I. Amen.

message_id: 17b65c34c7fea998

*Today’s Verses:*

*Wrongdoers listen to wicked talk; liars pay attention*

*to destructive words. Those who mock the poor indult*

*their Maker; those who rejoice at the misfortune of*

*others will be punished. *(Pro. 17:4, 5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Few acts are as cruel as making fun of the less fortunate,

but many people do this because it makes them feel good

to be better off or more successful than someone else.

Mocking the poor is mocking the God who made them.

We also ridicule God when we mock the weak, those

who are different, or anyone else. When you catch your-

self putting others down just for fun, stop and think about

who created them.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me if I should ever make *

*cruel statements about those who are less fortunate than *

*I. **Amen.*

subject: RESTORE WANDERING BELIEVERS
verse: Disregarding another person’s faults preserves love;  Telling about them separates close friends. (Proverbs 17:9)
reflection:
What is being said here is, that we should be willing to disregard the faults of others.
Covering over offenses is necessary to any relationship. It is tempting, especially in an argument, to bring up all the mistakes the other person has ever made. Love, however, keeps it’s mouth shut—difficult though that may be. Try never to bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to the topic being discussed. As we grow to be like Christ, we will acquire God’s ability to forget the confessed sins of the past.
prayer: Dear Heavenly father, help me to disregard the faults of others, for You know only too well, that I have plenty of my own. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b6a593afcc2405
subject   : Subject: RESTORE WANDERING BELIEVERS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 21 Aug 2021 15:13:58 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Disregarding another person’s faults preserves love; *

*Telling about them separates close friends. *(Pro. 17:9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

What is being said here is, that we should be willing to disregard

the faults of others. Covering over offenses is necessary to any
relationship. It is tempting, especially in an argument, to bring

up all the mistakes the other person has ever made. Love, however,

keeps it’s mouth shut—difficult though that may be. Try never to

bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to the topic being

discussed. As we grow to be like Christ, we will acquire God’s ability

to forget the confessed sins of the past.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly father, help me to disregard the faults **of others, *

*for You know only too well, that I have plenty **of my own. **Amen.*

subject: TRUE FRIENDSHIP ---IS?
verse: A friend is always loyal, and a brother is born to help in time of need. (Proverbs 17:17)
reflection:
The question we should ask our-selves each day IS;
“What kind of friend am I?” Let us not forget—there
is a vast difference between, knowing someone well,
and being a true friend. The greatest evidence of
genuine friendship is loyalty —read (I Corinthians 13:7).
Loyalty IS: being available in times of distress or
personal struggle. To many people, are fair-weather
friends.
They stick around when the friendship helps
them and leave when they are not getting anything
out of the relationship. Let us remember our friends
and assess our loyalty to them! Let us remember to be the kind of friend the Bible encourages!!!
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, If I have wounded any soul today, please forgive me—and help me to restore friendship. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b6f876b2732854
subject   : Subject: TRUE FRIENDSHIP ---IS?
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 22 Aug 2021 15:22:31 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*A friend is always loyal, and a brother is born to*

* help in time of need. *(Pro. 17:17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The question we should ask our-selves each day IS;

“*What kind of friend am I*?” Let us not forget—there

is a vast difference between, *knowing someone* * well*,

and being *a true friend*. The greatest evidence of

genuine friendship is *loyalty*—read (I Cor. 13:7).

*Loyalty IS*: being available in times of distress or

personal struggle. *To many people*, *are* fair-weather

friends. They stick around when the friendship helps

them and leave when they are not getting anything

out of the relationship. *Let us remember our friends*

*and assess our loyalty to them*! *Let us remember to*

*be the kind of friend the Bible encourages!!!*

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, If I have wounded any soul*

*today, please forgive me—and help me to restore*

*friendship. **Amen.*

subject: LOOKING FOR FEED BACK
verse: A cheerful heart is good medicine, BUT a broken spirit saps a person’s strength. (Proverbs 17:22)
reflection:
To be cheerful is to be ready to greet others with a
welcome, a word of encouragement, an enthusiasm
for the task at hand, and a positive outlook on the
future.
Such people are as welcome as pain-relieving
medicine.
prayer: Loving God, help us to cultivate cheerfulness in our hearts, that we may bring joy and encouragement to those around us. May our positive attitudes and welcoming spirits be a source of comfort and healing to others, reflecting Your love in all we do. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17b74edd0da6e0e8

*Subject: LOOKING FOR FEED BACK (please)*



*Today’s Verse:*

*A cheerful heart is good medicine, BUT a broken*

*spirit saps a person’s strength. *(Pro. 17:22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

To be cheerful is to be ready to greet others with a

welcome, a word of encouragement, an enthusiasm

for the task at hand, and a positive outlook on the

future. Such people are as welcome as pain-relieving

medicine.

*Pastor Sather*



I have been looking for some feed-back concerning

these messages. Out of 63 people I have received

2 yes only 2 in the past 12 months. If you are too

busy let me know and I will not bother you any

longer.

subject: SILENCE IS GOLDEN
verse:
A truly wise person uses few words; a person with understanding is even-tempered. Even fools are thought to be wise when they keep silent; when they keep their mouths shut, they seem intelligent.
(Proverbs 17:27-28)
reflection:
This Proverb highlights several benefits of keeping
quiet;
(1) It is the best policy if you have nothing
worthwhile to say; (2) It allows you the opportunity
to listen and learn; (3) It gives you something in
common with those who are wise. Make sure you
pause to think and to listen so when you do speak
you will have something important to say.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I confess that I need You to bridle my tongue, because I often run off at the mouth without thinking. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b7f37fcded1944

*Today’s Verses:*

*A truly wise person uses few words; a person with*

*understanding is even-tempered. Even fools are*

*thought to be wise when they keep silent; when*

*they keep their mouths shut, they seem intelligent.*

(Pro. 17:27-28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This Proverb highlights several benefits of keeping

quiet; (1) It is the best policy if you have nothing

worthwhile to say; (2) It allows you the opportunity

to listen and learn; (3) It gives you something in

common with those who are wise. Make sure you

pause to think and to listen so when you do speak

you will have something important to say.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I confess that I need You*

*to bridle my tongue, because I often run off at*

*the mouth without thinking. **Amen.*

subject: "FOOT--IN--THE--MOUTH" DISEASE
verse: The mouth of fools is their ruin; their lips get  them into trouble. What dainty morsels rumors  are—but they sink deep into one’s heart. (Proverbs 18:7-8)
reflection:
It is hard to refuse to listen to gossip as it is to
turn down a delicious dessert. Taking just one
morsel of either one creates a taste for more.
You can resist rumors the-same-way a deter-
mined dieter resists candy—never even open
the box. If you don’t nibble on the first bite of
gossip, you can’t take the second and the third.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me measure carefully any so called new news being spread about another person, and not pass on something that is fact- less. Amen.

It is hard to refuse to listen to gossip as it is to

turn down a delicious dessert. Taking just one

You can resist rumors the-same-way a deter-

mined dieter resists candy—never even open

the box. If you don’t nibble on the first bite of

*Pastor Sather*

*person, and not pass on something that is fact-*

*less. **Amen. *

subject: GOD OR WEALTH
verse: The rich think of their wealth as an impregnable defense; they imagine it is a high wall of safety. (Proverbs 18:11)
reflection:
To imagine their wealth is their strongest defense,
rich people are sadly mistaken. Money cannot
provide safety—there are to many ways for it to
lose its power. The government may cease to back
it—thieves nay steal it—inflation may rob it of all
value. But God never loses His power. He is always dependable. Where do you look for security
and safety—in uncertain wealth OR God who is
always faithful?
prayer: Dear Lord, forgive me for having looked in all the wrong places for security from time to time. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b897eaba3303fc
subject   : Subject: GOD OR WEALTH
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 27 Aug 2021 16:23:05 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The rich think of their wealth as an impregnable*

* defense; they imagine it is a high wall of safety.*

(Pro. 18:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

To imagine their wealth is their strongest defense,

rich people are sadly mistaken. Money *cannot*

provide safety—there are to many ways for it to

lose its power. The government may cease to back

it—thieves nay steal it—inflation may rob it of all

value. *But* God *never* loses His power. He is

*always* dependable. Where do you look for security

and safety—in uncertain wealth *OR* God who is

always faithful?

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, forgive me for having looked in all*

*the wrong places for security from time to time.*

*Amen. *

subject: WEIGH CAREFULLY ALL FACTS
verse: what a shame, what a folly, to give advice before listening to the facts.— Intelligent people are al- ways open to new ideas. In fact they look for them. Any story sounds true until someone sets the record  straight. (Proverbs 18:13, 15, 17)
reflection:
In these concise statements, there are three basic
principles for making sound decisions: (1) Get the
facts before answering. (2) Be open to new ideas.
(3)
Make sure you hear both sides of the story be-
fore judging. All three principles center around
seeking additional information. This is difficult
work, but the only alternative is prejudice—judg-
ing before getting the facts.
prayer: Dear Lord, I know I have been guilty at times of judging without knowing all the facts, please forgive me I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b8e99a96c1d167
subject   : Subject: WEIGH CAREFULLY ALL FACTS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 28 Aug 2021 16:10:40 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*what a shame, what a folly, to give advice before*

* listening to the facts.— Intelligent people are al-*

*ways open to new ideas. In fact they look for them.*

*Any story sounds true until someone sets the record *

*straight. *(Pro. 18:13, 15, 17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In these concise statements, *there are* three basic

principles for making sound decisions: (1) Get the

facts before answering. (2) Be open to new ideas.

(3) Make sure you hear both sides of the story be-

fore judging. *All three* principles center around

seeking additional information. This is difficult

work, but the only alternative is prejudice—judg-

ing before getting the facts.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, I know I have been guilty at times*

*of judging* *without knowing all the facts, please*

*forgive me I pray in Jesus name. **Amen.*

subject: FOR HEAVENS SAKE TELL HER SO! ! !
verse: A man who finds a wife finds a treasure and receives favor from the Lord. (Proverbs 18:22)
reflection:
This verse states that it is good to be married. Today’s
emphasis on individual freedom is misguided. Strong
individuals are important but so are strong marriages.
God created marriages for our enjoyment, and He pro- nounced it good.
Amid the cares of married life—In spite of toil and
business strife—If you value you wife Tell her so!
There was a time you thought it bliss—To get the
favor of a kiss—A dozen now won’t come a miss—
Tell her so!
Do not act as if she has passed her prime—As though
to please her were a crime—If ever you loved her
now is the time to—Tell her so!
Never let her heart grow cold—Richer beauties will
unfold—She is worth her weight in gold—Tell her so!
prayer: Help me to never grow inconsiderate of the gift You have blest me with, I pray this all in Jesus name.
original_content:
message_id: 17b938ac63f8c648
subject   : Subject: FOR HEAVENS SAKE TELL HER SO! ! !
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;

===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*A man who finds a wife finds a treasure and receives*

* favor from the Lord. *(Pro. 18:22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This verse states that it is good to be married. Today’s

emphasis on individual freedom is misguided. Strong

individuals are important but so are strong marriages.

God created marriages for our enjoyment, and He pro-

nounced it good.



Amid the cares of married life—In spite of toil and

business strife—If you value you wife *Tell her so!*



There was a time you thought it bliss—To get the

favor of a kiss—A dozen now won’t come a miss—

*Tell her so!*



Do not act as if she has passed her prime—As though

to please her were a crime—If ever you loved her

now is the time to—*Tell her so*!



Never let her heart grow cold—Richer beauties will

unfold—She is worth her weight in gold—*Tell her so*!

*Pastor Sather*

*Help me to never grow inconsiderate of the gift You*

*have blest me with, I pray this all in Jesus name.*

subject: A TRUE FRIEND
verse: There are “friends” who destroy each other, but  real friends stick closer than a brother. (Proverbs 18:24)
reflection:
Loneliness is everywhere—many people feel cut
off and alienated from others. Being in a crowd
just makes people more aware of their isolation.
We all need friends who will stick close, listen,
care, and offer help when it is needed—in good
times and bad. A friend is—
A push when you are stopped—
A guide when you are searching—
A song when you are glad—
A word when you are lonely—
A smile when you are sad—
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to recognize people who need a true friend and then give me the ability to take on the challenge. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17b98f23ad74b6b5
subject   : Subject: A TRUE FRIEND
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 30 Aug 2021 16:23:37 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*There are “friends” who destroy each other, but*

*real friends stick closer than a brother. *(Pro.18:24)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Loneliness is everywhere—many people feel cut

off and alienated from others. Being in a crowd

just makes people more aware of their isolation.

We all need friends who will stick close, listen,

care, and offer help when it is needed—in good

times and bad.

*A friend is—*

A push when you are stopped—

A guide when you are searching—

A song when you are glad—

A word when you are lonely—

A smile when you are sad—

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to recognize people*

*who need a true friend and then give me the ability*

*to take on the challenge. **Amen. *

subject: ADJUSTING PRIORITIES
verse: It is better to be poor and honest than to be a fool and dishonest. (Proverbs 19:1)
reflection:
A blameless life is far more valuable than wealth,
but most people don’t act as if they believed this.
Afraid of not getting everything they want, they
will pay any price to increase their wealth—
cheating on their taxes, stealing from stores or
employers, withholding tithes, refusing to give.
But when we know and love God, we realize that
a lower standard of living—or even poverty—is
a small price to pay for personal integrity. Do your
actions show that you sacrifice your integrity to
increase your wealth? What changes do you need
to make in order to get your priorities straight?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I am far from perfect and never will be on this side of paradise, so I pray You will continue to be patient with me while we work together on my problems. Amen
original_content:
message_id: 17b9dd568807f976
subject   : Subject: ADJUSTING PRIORITIES
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;

*Today’s Verse:*

*It is better to be poor and honest than to be a fool*

*and dishonest. *(Pro. 19:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

A blameless life is far more valuable than wealth,

but most people don’t act as if they believed this.

Afraid of not getting everything they want, they

will pay any price to increase their wealth—

cheating on their taxes, stealing from stores or

employers, withholding tithes, refusing to give.

But when we know and love God, we realize that

a lower standard of living—or even poverty—is

a small price to pay for personal integrity. Do your

actions show that you sacrifice your integrity to

increase your wealth? What changes do you need

to make in order to get your priorities straight*?*

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I am far *

*from perfect and never will be on this side of*

*paradise, so I pray You will continue to be *

*patient with me while we work together on*

*my * *problems. Amen*
